area.title: New Mediums for Discourse
area.description: The tools we use for online discussion have changed little in decades. But these designs bake in assumptions about discussion that limit our capabilities for exchange. How can we design new mediums for online discourse that make it easier to listen, share, and create?

area.title: Community Self-Governance
area.description: Despite their growth, online communities have few tools to shape their own norms and rules, resulting in top-down governance structures that cause burn out and strife. We design democratic structures that support community resilience as well as tools for self-governance.

area.title: End User Empowerment and Localization
area.description: Many applications and models today follow a one-size-fits-all approach, leaving marginalized groups with no recourse. Instead, we consider tools that give power back to end users so they can build solutions that suit them. And we design new applications and models that can take into account social nuances and different perspectives.

area.title: Collaboration and Knowledge Management
area.description: Production and knowledge management is increasingly done by (sometimes large) groups of people working together with different skill sets and domain expertise. We design new software tools and human-AI hybrid systems to help groups achieve goals and collectively organize information.

area.title: Pro-Social Platform Design
area.description: Online platforms find themselves host to harassing behavior, polarizing discourse, and disinformation campaigns. How can we reimagine social media to push back against bad actors, promote pro-social interaction and credible information, and respect privacy? How do we guard against negative emergent properties?

area.title: Public Interest Technology
area.description: Technology presents exciting opportunities but also many challenges for strengthening public institutions and civil society. How can technology help with broadening participation in civic activity, connecting people at the local level with support, and getting broad access to public resources and information?
